IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO CREATE AN EFFECTIVE, AUTHENTIC AND DYNAMIC ORGANIZATION TO GIVE VOICE AND SUBSTANCE TO THE POSSIBILITIES FOR SPECIALITY COFFEE WORLDWIDE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO CREATE AN EFFECTIVE, AUTHENTIC AND DYNAMIC ORGANIZATION TO GIVE VOICE AND SUBSTANCE TO THE POSSIBILITIES FOR SPECIALITY COFFEE WORLDWIDE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association is exempt from income taxes under Section 501(c)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Association follows the guidance of Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 740, Accounting for Income Taxes, related to uncertainties in income taxes, which prescribes a threshold of more likely than not for recognition and derecognition of tax positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. There are no uncertain tax positions as of December 31, 2022.
ACTUAL COSTS ARE REPORTED, TRANSLATED INTO U.S. DOLLARS.

Housing allowance or residence for personal use - One Person, Ioannis Apostolopoulos, receives with his semi-monthly payroll check an amount of $2,916.67 less payroll taxes, a housing allowance. Commenced January 1, 2020. Travel for companions - One Person, Ioannis Apostolopoulos, this is a contractual benefit with a maximum benefit of $10,000.
There is no written policy and also no reimbursements made this year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6 & 7A:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: 1) COMPANY MEMBERS-CORP, LARGE, MEDIUM, SMALL, ASSOCIATE 2) INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS-PROFESSIONAL, ROASTER, TECHNICIAN, BARISTA 3) COMPANY INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS (CIMS-COMPLEMENTARY) ALL MEMBERS HAVE VOTING RIGHTS EXCEPT CIMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Forms are reviewed by the Deputy CFO and the Financial Controller.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: It is referred to and agreed to at the start of each board meeting in the consent documents

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE INCLUDES THE BOARD PRESIDENT, 1ST AND 2ND VICE PRESIDENTS, SECRATARY/treasurer, AND IMMEDIATE PAST PRESIDENT. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECOTR HAS A WRITTEN CONRACT THAT, BASED ON THE PERFORMANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION AGAINST THE ANNUAL BUDGET, HAS A PRE-DETERMINED RAISE AND BONUS INCREASES IN IT. KEY EMPLOYEES: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS SOLELY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE COMPENSATION REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF KEY EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY & FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDIT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE IN PROGRESS, HOWEVER, HAVE NOT BEEN ISSUED AS OF THE DATE OF THIS FORM 990 FILING. IF IT BECOMES KNOWN THAT ANYTHING SIGNIFICANTLY CHANGED AN AMENDED FORM 990 WILL BE FILED.
The organization is in process to have an independent audit of its financial statements in the winter of 2023.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: The taxpayer requests that any potential late filing penalties and interest be removed since they timely tried to submit the return, but the IRS failed to update the taxpayer's year end to a calendar year so the efile was rejected. The tax return was submitted on 11/14/2023 and rejected multiple times. The IRS was called on 11/16/2023 and received case number IM576556. The IRS did not resolve the issue until 12/14/2023.
